text.p: Write a function called gcd that calculates the greatest common divisor of two positive integers. The gcd of two or more integers, when at least one of them is not zero, is the largest positive integer that divides the numbers without a remainder.
One way is recursively, where the greatest common denominator of a and b can be calculated as gcd(a, b) = gcd(b, a mod b). Do not import anything.
For example, the greatest common divisor (gcd) between a = 20 and b = 12 is 4.
text.pre: def gcd(a, b): """ a, b: two positive integers Returns the greatest common divisor of a and b """ #YOUR CODE HERE
text.p: Paste your entire function, including the definition, in the box below. Do not leave any print statements.
